intro: Malanea schomburgkii, commonly known as the Schomburgk's malanea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. Malanea schomburgkii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
